slts.slt: I can mint an Andamio Learner Token.
I can commit to an Assignment.
I can see an on-chain record of my completed Assignment.
I know the ways that people can participate in Andamio.
I know where to learn more about Andamio.
I can leave a comment on the Andamio paper.
I can participate in the Andamio Community.

modules.title: Contribution and Treasury Management in Andamio

slts.slt: I can mint a Contributor Token in Andamio.
I can commit to a Project in Andamio.
I understand how Andamio flexibly combines education, onboarding, and organizational management.
I can write a Student Learning Target.
I can use potential Assignments to write supporting SLTs.
I can organize Student Learning Targets into Course Modules.
I can write and publish a PBL Course Contract.
I can connect a Lesson to a Student Learning Target.
I can write a Lesson in Markdown.
I can write an Assignment in Markdown.
I can connect Assignments to multiple Student Learning Targets.
I can customize my Andamio Instance.

modules.title: Get Ready to Build Your Own Andamio Instance

slts.slt: I can make a merge request to a project on GitLab.
I can fork this Andamio template and use NodeJS to run it on my computer.
I can show my Course Outline in my instance of Andamio.

modules.title: How to manage a Treasury with Andamio

slts.slt: I can initialize an Andamio Treasury instance.
I can add Projects and Contributors to an Andamio Treasury Instance.
I can fund Projects with Andamio.
I understand how SLTs are used in the Andamio Network.
